sub_title: Buying Manager at Talpa Network | Talpa E-Commerce
summary:
I am a commercial professional with experience in relationship management & building, and aquiring new buisness. Through P&L management I build revenues, safeguard margins through negotiations, and ensure that costs remain lean. By cultivating strong customer relationships at HQ level I guarantee long-lasting successes. 

In addition to the skills mentioned below, I have successfully produced and set the precedent for cross-departmental communications within various organizations. I am a great team driver, project manager, strategic planner, negotiator, leader and coordinator. My love for planning and timelines enables me to prioritize appropriately and juggle many tasks simultaneously while ensuring all stakeholders are fully updated every step of the way. I am a logical thinker and always think a few steps ahead to ensure the most efficient process is being followed whilst achieving the best possible results. 

Key Skills:
Global Product Development & Planning
International Business Relations
Project Management
Consumer Insights
Interpersonal Communication Skills

Industries:
Consumer Goods
Retail
Sales
Communication
FMCG
eCommerce

I am open to professional networking. Please feel free to message me here in LinkedIn.

Looking forward to adding value to you!

contributors.headline: Buying Manager at Talpa Network | Talpa E-Commerce

projects.title: Yakult Branding Project
projects.description:
The Hague University of Applied Sciences partnered up with Yakult Europe for this project. The assignment was to develop a brand extension of Yakult and research its effectiveness in a new out of home channel.The duration of this project was 3 months and focussed on maintaing the brand's core identity and image whilst investigating other market options for Yakult.
﻿

profile_positions.description:
As Buyer at Talpa E-commerce my responsibilities include but are not limited to:
- Planning of stock for inline assortments
- Rolling-out New products
- Creating new subcategory opportunities 
- Managing supplier relationships
- Seeking new business opportunities by expanding supplier networks
- Analyzing market trends
- Monitoring customer buying behaviour
- Optimizing online positioning of products
- Ensuring optimal GPMs per product
profile_positions.title: International Buyer

profile_positions.description:
- Developing and implementing international sales strategies with international retailers in DACH, FR, and IT territories
- Expanding the reach and visibility of various beauty brands such as beautyblender, Peter Thomas Roth, Patchology, STYLEDRY, Popband, Naturally Serious, and Tweezerman.
- Managing and developing existing retailer relationships as well as acquiring new accounts 
- Providing creative input for NPD concepts
- Assembling assortments from external brands for stockholding
- Developing and implementing marketing and customer execution plans with partners
- Negotiating T&Cs with new and existing businesses to ensure maximum profitability
- Monitoring ongoing business trends to effectively forecast future sales 
- Safeguarding margins and manage account P&L responsibilities

* Authored STYLEDRY Code of Conduct
* Authored STYLEDRY Anti-Corruption Policy
profile_positions.title: International Key Account Manager

profile_positions.description:
Coordinate, communicate and manage the priorities of the following categories:
- Health and beauty
- Housewares (core category)
- Keychains
- Desktop

The responsibilities aim to support category growth and sales performance measures for the global brands of:

- Bullet
- Avenue
- Jamie Oliver
- Paul Bocuse
- Seasons

FUNDAMENTAL DUTIES

- Communicate and coordinate all phases of the development cycle as applies to duties and product development time and action of the product launch.
- Analyse and report on sales and market trends. React to these trends and applies the findings to development plans.
- Ensure timely delivery of products and supporting product information to internal and cross-functional departments.
- Conduct and communicate competitive analyses focused on key price points for all assigned categories.
- Maintain sales and margin targets set for appointed categories.
- Direct timely execution of milestone events required to launch new products.
- Develop and execute training/sales tools to assist sales force with information on new and existing product lines.
- Partner with internal departments (planning, marketing, warehouse, decoration team, e.g.) to drive innovative product launches.
- Adhere to product launch timeline and action plans.
- Create appealing product names and texts.
- Cross divisional collaboration with the Planning department.

profile_positions.title: Assistant Category Manager

profile_positions.description:

• Issue troubleshooting and resolving

• Training and being main point of contact for new collegues in the field

profile_positions.description:

profile_positions.title: Area Manager

profile_positions.description:
My responsibilities at Dior include creating online content such as banners, storefinders, mood visuals, content pages and emailings for retailers associated with Dior in the Netherlands. Creating offline content is also a component of my daily tasks such as composing postmailings for retailers. 

Coordinating with the headquarters in Paris is an imperative component of daily tasks as their approval is needed for the publication of materials. 

Creating flash analyses of all online content sent out by Dior is also part of my responsibilities.

Onilne category management of online retailer's shops and making sure all packshots, segment visuals, and product descriptions are kept up-to-date.
profile_positions.title: CRM, Media & Online Intern

profile_positions.description: At Cordaid my responsibilities consisted of conducting daily media scans, creating online content for their various social media platforms, managing the online image database, conducting a online and offline media analysis, contacting educational institutions and informing them about Cordaid's new "PWS Prijs", researching online channels and tools and assessing the extent to which Cordaid would benefit from making use of them.
profile_positions.title: Corporate Communications Intern

profile_positions.description: As part of my study at The Hague University of Applied Sciences I was given the possibility to do an Internship which I decided to do at two companies, the second being Base Consulting. At Base, my responsibilities comprised of creating weekly workstream updates, conducting market research for pitches, translating media clippings from Dutch into English, and preparing presentations for client meetings. It was also my responsibility to act as an intermediary between the customers and businesses aiding in the content creation process.
profile_positions.title: Intern

profile_positions.description: I worked at ‘t Fust part-time during my studies where I was responsible for opening up the restaurant and preparing for the shift of the day. There were daily menu’s which required memorizing this menu on a daily basis and trying to sell as many as possible to guests. I was also responsible for training students from the Hospitality School in Leiden and mentor them throughout their “internship” at the restaurant to become all-round waiters and waitresses at the restaurant.
profile_positions.title: Waitress

profile_positions.description: I worked here part-time during my studies as a waitress. I was responsible for ensuring that customers had an enjoyable experience whilst stimulating sales at the restaurant. Here I was also responsible for training new staff although here it was predominantly trainings behind the bar.
profile_positions.title: Waitress
